radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple small nodules in both adrenal glands (largest 17 mm in diameter), characteristics of an adenoma; otherwise normal.
Perihilar linear opacity suggestive of mild subsegmental atelectasis.
Mucosal thickening of the maxillary sinus.
Region of hypoattenuation within the pancreatic head thought to represent a peripancreatic lymph node.
